basics.name: Kenneth Kutyn
basics.label: Solutions Engineer, Product Manager, Public Speaker, MBA, Experimenter, Builder

work.name: Optimizely
work.summary: Guided customers and prospects through technical validation of Optimizely’s client-side and server-side progressive delivery and experimentation platforms, including PoCs, workshops, and demos. Developed relationships with technical contacts at key accounts. Received rapid promotions to Senior and Lead Solutions Engineer in first 3 years.
highlights: Guided customers and prospects through technical validation of Optimizely’s client-side and server-side progressive delivery and experimentation platforms, including PoCs, workshops, and demos. Developed relationships with technical contacts at key accounts. Received rapid promotions to Senior and Lead Solutions Engineer in first 3 years.

work.name: Rightly
work.summary: Assessed product-market fit and developed product prototypes to secure seed-funding for a personal data startup. Worked with engineers, designers, and lawyers to deliver MVP and conduct user feedback sessions. Transitioned to advisor role to provide ongoing strategic guidance.
highlights: Assessed product-market fit and developed product prototypes to secure seed-funding for a personal data startup. Worked with engineers, designers, and lawyers to deliver MVP and conduct user feedback sessions. Transitioned to advisor role to provide ongoing strategic input.

work.name: Oracle
work.summary: Assisted Oracle customers in transitioning from traditional on-premises BI and Analytics, to a modern cloud-based platform. Acted as a leader for sales team, including running numerous internal trainings for Account Executives on the benefits of cloud technology.
highlights: Assisted Oracle customers in transitioning from traditional on-premises BI and Analytics, to a modern cloud-based platform. Acted as a leader for sales team, including running numerous internal trainings for Account Executives on the benefits of cloud technology.

interests.name: J'aime faire de la course à pied et des randonnées en famille le weekend.

projects.name: DeckBuilder - Web App
projects.description: A web app that generates a custom sales deck for a customer including table of contents, sections, architecture diagrams, customer logos, account team and more.

projects.name: biasBlocker - Chrome Extension
projects.description: Unconscious bias is a documented problem in the recruiting process. This Chrome extension hides candidate images on their LinkedIn and XING profile so they can be evaluated for their experience, not their race.

projects.name: Amsterdam Transport Planner - Web App
projects.description: A simple mobile web app that helps commuters plan their trip. Built to demonstrate use of AJAX requests, public APIs, and CSS animations.

projects.name: Simply - Budgeting App Prototype
projects.description: A prototype for an iPhone app aimed at giving users an easy way to track personal expenses and make data-driven budgeting decisions.

basics.personalDescription:
Sales Engineer: 8 years experience leading PoCs, demos, workshops and onboarding sessions for various software products (BI, Analytics, Data Visualization, Experimentation, Feature Flagging, CAD, CAE, BIM).

Customer Empathy: experience in technical support and customer success roles, acting as an advocate for customer needs in product development.

Product Manager: Lead product management in a startup and secured seed and series A funding. Studied Product Management at Stanford University Continuing Studies.

MBA Candidate: Ongoing studies at Maastricht School of Management with specialization in International Business. Target completion Fall 2020.

Experimenter: Consulted Optimizely's enterprise customers across EMEA on experimentation strategy and technical considerations.

Engineering Background and First Principles thinking: Degree in Civil Engineering at the University of British Columbia.

Public Speaker & Panel Moderator: Product School, DMEXCO, AB Testing Summit, Virtual Product Conference and more. Toastmasters 'Competent Communicator' certified.

International Experience: Lived and worked in Canada, UK, USA and the Netherlands, and presented to customers in 15+ countries.

work.codingReason: J'ai commencé à coder sur Amstrad dans ma cave et je n'ai jamais arrêté depuis

specific.interestedBy: Angular, la blochain et les chatons.
